content: phase spiral blanket 1 contents introduction 3 yarn & hooks 3 abbreviations 4 how many squares will i need 4 the pattern 6 2 introduction this pattern is for the phase spiral blanket inspired by the phase spirals in the milky way discovered using the gaia telescope in 2018 the spirals are made as individual squares working 2 colors at a time which are then all joined and decorated with a simple border using the remaining yarn yarn & hooks since the blanket has a modular construction you can make it as big/small as you want a guide on how many squares are needed for a single/double/queen blanket will be given the pictured blanket measures 100/150 cm using 11 x 15 squares the spirals in the pictured blanket used a 3 5mm crochet hook and 4 ply yarn with the squares ending up being 9cm in width expect a larger and thicker blanket when using aran and dk yarn the blanket in this pattern uses one cotton kings 500g cotton cone in black 09 and 9 x 50g balls of hobbi friends cotton 8/4 print in different colors if you re making a bigger blanket you will need more yarn see the next page for guidance some colors have been discontinued since my purchase so below are the alternative colorways as of 2025 03 - strawberry love 02 - sea buckthorn 01 - summer sunrise 12 - jungle green 10 - fresh mint 09 - tropical ocean 07 - lavender potpourri 34 - violets 06 - raspberry sorbet 3 abbreviations all patterns are in us terms and with standard crochet abbreviations a list will be provided below as a reminder single_crochet single_crochet hdc2tog half-double_crochet 2 together double_crochet double_crochet decrease single_crochet 2 together half_double_crochet half-double_crochet sl-st slip-stitch chain chain how many squares will i need to cover a single bed 90 x 190 cm you should aim for a 9 x 20 grid of spirals you will need 1 x 500g cone and 1 x 50g ball of each color to cover a double bed 140 x 190 cm you should aim for a 14 x 20 grid of spirals you will need 2 x 500g cones and 2 x 50g balls of each color to cover a queen bed 160 x 200 cm you should aim for a 17 x 21 grid of spirals you will need 2 x 500g cones and 3 x 50g balls of each color note the border will add 12 cm of width the table below provides the number of squares needed in each color color single double queen strawberry love 20 32 40 sea buckthorn 20 32 40 summer sunrise 20 32 40 jungle green 20 32 40 fresh mint 20 31 40 tropical ocean 20 30 40 lavender potpourri 20 30 39 violets 20 30 39 raspberry sorbet 20 31 39 total 180 280 357 4 suggested layouts single double queen 5 pattern instructions the pattern starts off with crocheting the spiral squares
